name: Yellowstone National Park
description: The first U.S. national park, famous for geysers and wildlife.

name: Yosemite National Park
description: Granite cliffs, giant sequoias, and stunning waterfalls.

name: Grand Canyon National Park
description: Iconic canyon carved by the Colorado River.

name: Zion National Park
description: Steep red cliffs and scenic canyon hikes.

name: Bryce Canyon National Park
description: Famous for its hoodoos—unique rock spires.

name: Rocky Mountain National Park
description: High peaks, alpine lakes, and abundant wildlife.

name: Glacier National Park
description: Known for its rugged mountains and glacial valleys.

name: Grand Teton National Park
description: Dramatic Teton Range and pristine lakes.

name: Arches National Park
description: Over 2,000 natural stone arches in the desert.

name: Joshua Tree National Park
description: Desert landscapes and distinctive Joshua trees.

name: Sequoia National Park
description: Home to giant sequoia trees, including General Sherman.

name: Kings Canyon National Park
description: Deep canyons and high mountain wilderness.

name: Olympic National Park
description: Rainforests, coastline, and snow-capped peaks.

name: Acadia National Park
description: Coastal park in Maine with rocky shores and mountains.

name: Everglades National Park
description: Subtropical wetlands home to alligators and unique ecosystems.

name: Great Smoky Mountains National Park
description: America’s most visited park, straddling NC and TN.

name: Shenandoah National Park
description: Skyline Drive and Blue Ridge Mountain vistas.

name: Denali National Park
description: Home to Denali, the highest peak in North America.

name: Haleakalā National Park
description: Volcanic landscapes and sunrise views above the clouds.

name: Badlands National Park
description: Eroded buttes and mixed-grass prairie in South Dakota.
